title: SPAC Slowdown Tests Asia’s Fledgling Market for Blank-Check Firms
sub_head: So far just five blank-check companies have listed in either Hong Kong or Singapore
body:
Two of Asia’s financial hubs aimed to reinvent the SPAC. So far, it is proving slow going.
Exchanges in Hong Kong and Singapore have always said they aim for quality not quantity with their rules for blank-check companies, touting better investor protection than in the U.S.
